# Cleaning and preprocessing the data 
## load necessary packages
```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(knitr)
library(tableone)
library(questionr)

library(ggplot2)
library(lubridate)
library(patchwork)
library(gridExtra)
library(psych)
library(corrplot)
library(ggfortify)
library(factoextra)
library(class) #knn
library(gmodels) # CrossTable()
library(caret) # creatFolds()
library(caTools) #sample.split()
library(ROCR) # prediction(), performance()
```

## read data from csv
```{r}
df = read_csv("/Users/chuxuan/Desktop/biostat707/class_project/mhcld-puf-2019.csv")
```

## remove correlated variables (variables that are not of interest)
```{r}
df1 <- df %>% select(-c("MH1", "MH2", "MH3", 
                        "SUB", "SMISED", "DETNLF", "NUMMHS", 
                        "DIVISION", "REGION", "CASEID", "YEAR"))
```

## explore missingness
```{r}
# NAs are labeled as -9 in the data
df1[df1 == -9] <- NA 
```

## remove NAs
## 1,185,836 observations after removing NAs
```{r}
df2 <- df1 %>% na.omit()
1 - nrow(df2)/nrow(df1)
```

## recode age as a numeric variable
```{r}
df3 <- df2 %>% mutate(recoded_age = ifelse(AGE == 1, 5.5,
                              ifelse(AGE == 2, 13, 
                                ifelse(AGE == 3, 16, 
                                  ifelse(AGE==4, 19,
                                    ifelse(AGE==5, 23, 
                                      ifelse(AGE==6, 27,
                                        ifelse(AGE==7, 32, 
                                          ifelse(AGE==8, 37,
                                            ifelse(AGE==9, 42, 
                                              ifelse(AGE==10,47, 
                                                ifelse(AGE==11, 53, 
                                                  ifelse(AGE==12, 57, 
                                                    ifelse(AGE==13, 62, 
                                                      ifelse(AGE==14, 72, NA))))))))))))))) %>% select(-c(AGE))
```

## table 1
```{r}
df_tab <-df3 %>% mutate(depress = as.factor(DEPRESSFLG)) %>%
  mutate(race = as.factor(RACE)) %>%
  mutate(gender = as.factor(GENDER)) %>%
  mutate(education = as.factor(EDUC)) %>% 
  mutate(employment = as.factor(EMPLOY)) %>%
  mutate(living = as.factor(LIVARAG)) %>%
  select(c(recoded_age, depress, race, gender, education, employment, living))
var=c("recoded_age", "race", 
      "gender", "education", "employment", "living") 
table1 <- CreateTableOne(vars = var, data=df_tab, strata = c("depress"), addOverall = TRUE)
kable(print(table1, showAllLevels = TRUE))
```

## save preprocessed dataframe
```{r}
write.csv(df3, file = "mh_data.csv")
```




## K-means ckustering with n = 1000 sampled 
```{r}
# Sample 1000 from the processed dataset
df3_train = df3[sample(nrow(df3), 1000), ]

km.out = kmeans(df3_train,centers=5, nstart=20)
table(km.out$cluster)

fviz_cluster(km.out,data = df3_train,geom = "point")+xlab("PC1")+ylab("PC2")+ggtitle("K-Means clustering for two groups (k=2)")

```
## K-means ckustering with all observations
```{r}
km.out2 = kmeans(df3,centers=2, nstart=20)
table(km.out2$cluster)

fviz_cluster(km.out2,data = df3,geom = "point")+xlab("PC1")+ylab("PC2")+ggtitle("K-Means clustering for two groups (k=2)")

```
